alert.note: Alert for Cheatham; Davidson; Dickson; Montgomery; Robertson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 1:04AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Davidson, northern Dickson, southeastern Montgomery, northern Cheatham and Robertson Counties through 145 AM CDT... At 104 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles south of Russellville to 14 miles south of Clarksville. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Ashland City, Clarksville, White House, Millersville, Greenbrier, Coopertown, Ridgetop, Cross Plains, Joelton, Pleasant View, Orlinda, Adams, Cedar Hill, Slayden, Cheatham Dam and Black Jack. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 105 and 121. Interstate 24 between mile markers 13 and 36. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
